meanings.definition: Consisting of two parts or elements
meanings.sent1: The car had dual exhaust pipes.
meanings.sent3: The dual switches confused the electrician.
meanings.sent4: His dual personality made it hard to predict his actions.
meanings.sent5: The dual nature of the problem required a creative solution.

meanings.sent1: The smartphone had dual cameras for selfies.
meanings.sent2: The watch had dual time zones.
meanings.sent3: Her dual role as a teacher and a parent kept her busy.
meanings.sent4: The dual purpose of the tool amazed the inventor.
meanings.sent5: The dual benefits of exercise include physical and mental health.

meanings.definition: A pair of something closely related
meanings.sent1: The twins were a dual that everyone admired.
meanings.sent2: The dual of gloves lay forgotten on the bench.
meanings.sent3: The dual of keys unlocked the mystery box.
meanings.sent4: The dual of dancers moved in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent5: The dual of lovebirds chirped happily in the tree.
